subject: Programming
title: Rubber Duck Debugging
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Rubber Duck Debugging.

hook.text: Explain your bug to a rubber duck. Seriously. Many programmers swear it works.

buildup.text: The act of verbalizing forces you to organize your thoughts and walk through the code step by step.

discovery.text: Most of the time, you find the answer yourself halfway through the explanation.

twist.text: The duck doesn't need to respond. The magic is in forcing your brain out of its stuck loop.

climax.text: Teaching â€” even to an inanimate object â€” activates different brain pathways than silent thinking.

punchline.text: Explain the problem out loud. The answer follows.

quiz.question: Why does rubber duck debugging work?
options: Verbalizing forces you to organize your thoughts
It makes the code run in debug mode
